title: Augusta County: William L. Coan to W. E. Whiting, December 4, 1865
summary: Concerned about AMA administrators negligence in refunding "Bureau Supt" F. S. Tukey for personal funds expended for AMA school purposes, Coan insists that the AMA reimburse Tukey immediately and send much needed classroom resources to the Valley.
keywords: African Americans, Education, Economy, Race Relations, American Civil War
